conclusion: The problem involves a square wire frame on a horizontal surface with half in a magnetic field. Side length is 0.2m, resistance is 4Ω, and B = (3 + 2t)T.
The image shows a square wire frame with half in a magnetic field perpendicular to the plane and directed inward.
Plan to calculate magnetic force using B and determine frictional force by equating it to magnetic force.
Calculate B at t = 2.5s: B = (3 + 5) T = 8 T.
Magnetic force F_B is given by F_B = I × B × L.
Current I can be calculated using Ohm's law: I = V / R.
Resistance is 4 Ω, length in magnetic field is 0.1 m.
Calculate magnetic force F_B at t = 2.5s: F_B = 0.4 × I.
Frictional force F_f at t = 2.5s is F_f = F_B = 0.4 × I.
Magnitude of frictional force at t = 2.5s is F_f = 0.4 × 2.5 = 1 N.
